stories.title: Ask HN: How are you insulating your investments given the Ukraine situation?
Mastering Metacognition: The What, Why, and How

stories.text:
I always feel scary to grab command(s) from shell history and press "Enter" by accident. So I write this small tool which asks me to confirm when it finds something risky.

I expect the native interactive shell can do this for me. Feel free to give feedback and/or suggest a better way.

Thanks a lot.
stories.title: Show HN: "Ido” stops you if there is some risky arguments

stories.text:
I just wanted to check flightradar24.com - but no luck. Then went on to find other live map services and liveuamap.com also seems to be down.
I'm wondering, could these be related to what's going on in Ukraine? Have you encountered other outages that could be connected? These are not the official government sites that were reported to be attacked some hours ago, but live information sites with probably valuable information for civilians. Liveradar24 is not a military intelligence site, but some MIL transponder codes were tracked on there, as well. This the last archive.org snapshot of liveuamap: https://web.archive.org/web/20220223210344/https://liveuamap.com/
